page.title: 16BEACON HILL
page.content: Above Paradise Farm in the small hamlet of Heathstock is{Beacon Hill {Triangulation Point}in the SW.corner of the D-Block. It is 719 feet above sea-level. The view of our D-block from the Triangulation point is very good.The furthest you can see on a fine day is Seaton. There's an old story that the Triangalation Point used to be called "The Devil's Frying Pan". This is due to the shape of the hill, which looks like a handle, and a nearby clump of trees, which looks like the pan.The story goes that witches were burnt here. Later,effigies of witches were burnt. The local farmer remembers as a child being told by his father not to touch the charred sticks,as this would bring bad luck. Philip Mesher,11.
